measured_by: reaction time in the concept–property verification task
justification: “The dependent variable was the reaction time (RT) to the target concept-property items from the target property onset.”

measured_by: event-related potential components (N400, P600/LPC) recorded with EEG
justification: “Previous studies have found many ERP components associated with MSCs, most prominent of which were N400 and P600 or late positivity complex (LPC)… The present study sets out to… explore their activations during online processing using event-related EEG potentials (ERP).”

measured_by: Modality Exclusivity Norms ratings (Lynott & Connell, 2009; Van Dantzig et al., 2011)
justification: “The property words were selected from the modality exclusivity norms of Lynott and Connell (2009) and Dantzig … in which the property words were rated according to how strongly they could be experienced by the five major sensory modalities.”
construct: Sensory modality dominance of property words

measured_by: principal components analysis of word co-occurrence frequencies from the Google Web-1T corpus
justification: “We figured out the linguistic dimension of the property words using a principle components analysis (PCA) of the co-occurrence frequencies… resulting in a 244 × 244 matrix which was submitted to a PCA.”
construct: Linguistic distributional dimension of property words
